column4: Having an issue with my newly installed ubuntu on my Inspiron E1705. I get an IP address from my network card. I can ping and accually connected to my PC at home through VNC. But when browsing the net it takes about a minute to load any page. I also cannot get updates on my add/remove packages. Anyone know what might be wrong??
huh? I can't get updates it won't go through. take a minute to load a page. But everything else network wise is ok
you are connected on that box now? could you pastebin your sources.list please?
install pastebinit sudo apt-get install pastebinit then cat /etc/apt/sources.list | pastebinit
how about cat /etc/apt/sources.list and see if there are a bunch of hashmarks in front of the various repos
Yes there are # line commented out by installer because it failed to verify
most of them? just the backports? how many roughly
then you need to uncomment (remove the hashmarks) from the key ones; /msg ubotu gutsysources for which ones to uncomment
you have no sources; that would be the reason that add/remove is greyed out; open up the sources list with an editor and remove the hashes and then sudo apt-get update and try again
nano is a good one; unless you have another you like sudo nano etc etc
is there a reason why this happend on install? Maybe I didn't have internet connection?
aye that would be the reason
